Class Username

java.lang.Object
Username
public class Username extends Object
Username class refers to providing the name, both first and last, including student number, as getters and setters for accessing them through Driver class

    • generateUsername

      public String generateUsername()
      This method allows for username generation, utilizing first and last name, and the student number. each value is defined as a char array (char[]) and the values are converted to the char arrays. The only exception is that studentnumber is first converted to string before being converted to a char array. the variable username is initalized as an empty string for the process to work. the variable must equal itself + the char variables in for loops.

      In this program, typing 0's at the beginning of the student number removes them (example: 041232109 becomes 41232109, note the removal of the first zero), because of the conversion process from long to String to char. with the for loops, the char variables have the loop variable in the square brackets [] to add only the specified assigned array values from the loop according to the next variable value of the loop. 

      For instance:
      
 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
     username = username + lastnamesplit[i];
      {} omitted for viewing purposes
      if "Smith" were entered, lastnamesplit would have 5 values in the array, starting from 0. i variable increases to 3, and with i in lastnamesplit[], username would equal to itself + lastnamesplit[i] and i increased by 3, so the values S, m, and i would be counted. In other words, username would equal to Smi.
      Returns:
      username, containing values from firstname, lastname, and studentnumber as a string
